t: Amazon Prime lands in Brazil
s: May 15, 2019 - Amazon Prime, enjoyed by more than 100 million paid members across 18 countries, is now available to customers in Brazil. Prime members will enjoy unlimited nationwide free delivery on hundreds of thousands of items from baby to kitchen to electronics, books, and more, with no minimum purchase ...

t: Amazon.com plays catch-up in Brazil as local rivals thrive | Reuters
s: April 25, 2018 - A reassuring physical presence and fast-growing online sales have vaulted Magazine Luiza into the upper echelons of Brazilian e-commerce, lifting shares over 500 percent last year and 20 percent so far in 2018. The company is relying on deep roots in its home turf to survive an assault by ...

t: Amazon.com starts direct sales of merchandise in Brazil after delays | Reuters
s: January 22, 2019 - Amazon.com Inc is launching its long-awaited in-house fulfilment and delivery network in Brazil after months of delays caused by complicated logistics and a highly complex tax system in the largest Latin American economy.

t: New study links major fashion brands to Amazon deforestation | Brazil | The Guardian

t: Sorry Bezos, Brazil Already Has an Amazon. It's MercadoLibre - Bloomberg
s: October 28, 2019 - So it goes for Amazon in Latin America’s largest economy. Seven years after entering Brazil, the Seattle-based company is battling to gain traction against a handful of local competitors with extensive delivery networks, strong brands and a deep understanding of Brazilian shoppers.
